definition: to worship/to observe religious rites/to pay one's respects (to one's ancestors etc)
to pay respect/worship/visit/salute
surname Zhai
to offer a sacrifice to (gods or ancestors)/memorial ceremony/(in classical novels) to recite an incantation to activate a magic weapon/(lit. and fig.) to wield

sentences.english: This year was not at home, but would honor the heart inside.
sentences.chinese: 今年不在家，但是会在心里面拜祭。

sentences.english: Yu Fan worship offering wife, being followed.
sentences.chinese: 余凡拜祭妻子，觉被人跟踪。

sentences.english: The Qingming Festival in spring is the occasion for visiting  ancestral graves.
sentences.chinese: 清明节是扫墓拜祭先人的日子。

sentences.english: City Crematorium flowers honor the district, only two graves in the area.
sentences.chinese: 市火葬场鲜花拜祭区，只有两人在该区拜祭。

sentences.english: City Crematorium flowers honor the district, only two graves in the area.
sentences.chinese: 市火葬场鲜花拜祭区，只有两人在该区拜祭。

definition: to offer sacrifice (to one's ancestors)
to offer sacrifices to one's ancestors
to pay a formal visit/to call to pay respects/to pay homage (at a monument, mausoleum etc)
to offer sacrifices (to one's ancestors)/to hold or attend a memorial service
memorial tablet
memorial tablet
a worship ceremony for the dead/to offer sacrifice (to ancestors)/a libation
to formally call on/to worship (a God)/to pay homage to sb
to burn incense at a temple
to sweep a grave (and pay one's respects to the dead person)
sacrificial offerings/worship/religious rite
to burn incense
to mourn and offer prayers
to keep watch beside a coffin
to bury (the dead)
to visit a place for the memories/to pay homage to (the deceased)
